segments.en: “Mendicants, three kinds of people are bound for a place of loss, bound for hell, if they don’t give up this fault.
Someone who is unchaste, but claims to be celibate;

segments.pli: yo ca suddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ carantaṃ amūlakena abrahmacariyena anuddhaṃseti,
segments.en: someone who makes a groundless accusation of unchastity against a person whose celibacy is pure;

segments.pli: yo cāyaṃ evaṃvādī evaṃdiṭṭhi: ‘natthi kāmesu doso’ti, so tāya kāmesu pātabyataṃ āpajjati.
segments.en: and someone who has the view, ‘There is nothing wrong with sensual pleasures,’ so they throw themselves into sensual pleasures.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, tayo āpāyikā nerayikā idamappahāyā”ti.
segments.en: These are the three kinds of people bound for a place of loss, bound for hell, if they don’t give up this fault.”
